resources.string: Created by Ixchel Peralta, Nicholas Morris, Temo Meza, Llacki B.P., and Skylar Stockton
Grab a free randomly generated password while your here! You can never be too safe!

Enter your IP address in the format xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx numbers can range between 0 and 255
Enter your URL address with protocol http or https and a domain name including .com .net .gov like https://www.google.com 
Enter your email to find out if it has been compromised using haveibeenpwnd API 
Find your Ip addressHere

An IP address is four numbers separated by periods, and numbers can range from 0 to 255. IP stands for Internet Protocol. There are different types of addresses like consumer, private, public, and many more. An IP address is used to identify a device on the internet to make a connection to send and receive information. IP addresses may be used in a malicious way, like tracing your home address or spying on your private internet traffic.
Learn more
 https://www.kaspersky.com/resource-center/definitions/what-is-an-ip-address 
https://www.avast.com/c-what-is-an-ip-address 
https://us.norton.com/internetsecurity-privacy-what-does-an-ip-address-tell-you.html

URL stands for uniform resource locator. A URL is an address for a unique resource on the web. URLs have different parts like the protocol, domain name, path, and webpage. They should be human-readable text and identify the file structure of a website. 
Learn more
 https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/Common_questions/What_is_a_URL 
https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-a-url 
https://moz.com/learn/seo/url

A cyber threat is a malicious act or event with the potential to steal or damage data, modify information, denial of service, and disrupt digital life in general. Cyber threats can come from within an organization or remote locations by unknown users. Some common cyber threats include malware, phishing attacks, distributed denial of service(DDoS) attacks, and trojans.
Learn more
 https://www.europarl.europa.eu/news/en/headlines/society/20220120STO21428/cybersecurity-main-and-emerging-threats-in-2021-infographic#ssh 
https://csrc.nist.gov/glossary/term/cyber_threat 
https://www.cisa.gov/uscert/ics/content/cyber-threat-source-descriptions

A data breach is a security incident that exposes confidential information or protected information accessed by an unauthorized person. Types of data breaches included privilege escalation attacks, phishing, malware, denial of service, and advanced persistent threat(APT). In a data breach, some vulnerabilities that are targeted include weak credentials, stolen credentials, and unsecured devices.
Learn more
 https://www.kaspersky.com/resource-center/definitions/data-breach 
https://us.norton.com/internetsecurity-privacy-data-breaches-what-you-need-to-know.html 
https://www.investopedia.com/terms/d/data-breach.asp

Learn the basics and practice the best ways to stay secure:
https://overthewire.org 
https://www.hackthissite.org 
https://tryhackme.com 
https://www.cisa.gov/uscert/ncas/tips 
https://www.nist.gov/cybersecurity

The regional Internet registry is an organization that allocates, controls, and manages internet number resources in a specific region. There are 5 RIRs the APNIC, ARIN, RIPE NCC, LACNIC, and AFRINIC. In their respective regions, RIR works on the management, distribution, and registration of internet number resources. The global RIR system uniquely assigns an internet number resource to one party and ensures that they are distributed based on justified needs. 
Learn more
 https://www.nro.net/about/rirs 
https://www.apnic.net/about-apnic/organization/history-of-apnic/history-of-the-regional-internet-registries 
https://www.ripe.net/about-us/what-we-do/regional-internet-registry 
https://whatismyipaddress.com/rir

An autonomous system is a network or group of networks that have a unified routing policy, and all devices connected to the internet are connected to an AS. An autonomous system is operated by a single large organization, an enterprise technology company, a university, or a government agency. Autonomous system numbers are assigned to an autonomous system and serve as an identifier.
learn more
 https://www.techtarget.com/searchnetworking/definition/autonomous-system 
https://csrc.nist.gov/glossary/term/autonomous_system 
https://www.cloudflare.com/learning/network-layer/what-is-an-autonomous-system
